It's like there's a constant weight on my chest, making it hard for me to breathe. My romantic boyfriend is supportive, but even he can't fully understand what I'm going through. Sometimes I wish things could go back to how they were before, when things were simpler and less painful... but life has a way of moving forward, whether we want it to or not."

Event:
Depression

The main event in this passage is the individual's struggle with depression. The passage describes their emotional and mental state as "total garbage" since May of this year, and how they have experienced waves of depression that never truly get better. They mention feeling a sense of time running out and realizing some "terrible truths," feeling behind their peers, and experiencing age-related signs of aging. The individual also describes feeling hopeless and having lost their desire for hobbies. They express feelings of helplessness and despair, and how they have considered suicide in the past.
Post: "Feeling like I'm drowning in my own thoughts, struggling to keep my head above water since May. It's like time is running out and I'm still stuck in this never-ending cycle of depression. Every wave feels like a punch to the gut, and I've lost all motivation for things that used to bring me joy. Feeling so far behind my peers, it's like I'm running in place while everyone else is moving forward. And on top of it all, I'm starting to feel the weight of age-related signs of aging. It's like I'm trapped in a never-ending nightmare with no escape. Just feeling so hopeless and helpless, like there's no way out of this darkness. And worst of all, I've considered suicide before. It's like the thought of escaping this misery is the only thing that keeps me going. #depression #mentalhealth #struggling"
